results.title: So you're going on location
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
If pre-production meetings have been carefully enough organised then going on location should pose no problem. The location chosen is determined by the demands of the script, but before it is actually chosen permits for its use, budgetary considerations and familiarisation by the crew are essential. The film gives numerous hints for filming and graphically explains points of job allocations, camera use and lighting.

results.title: Using the land
results.creator_credit: Judith Adamson, Jan Punch and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Six themes: OWNING THE LAND, CHANGING THE LAND, FARMING THE LAND, MINING THE LAND, SETTLING THE LAND and APPRECIATING THE LAND. ‘USING THE LAND’ helps to provide answers to four major questions: What is the importance of the land to Australians? How have Australians used the land over time? What are the effects of its usage? What needs to be done to protect and conserve the environment as a sustainable resource for the future? Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Camera
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Uses interviews with cinematographers including Lazlo Kovacs, Lee Garmes and James Crabe to explain the major points of motion picture photography and cameras. Defines and explains many techniques including dolly shots, lenses, camera movement, film speeds and camera focus.

results.title: The Natural landscape
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
The series deals with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life, utilising material dating from the beginnings of filmmaking in this country, in the early 1900s.

results.title: Acting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Shows a stage actor during audition and his transition to a motion picture actor. Well known actors including Helen Hayes, Vincent Price, Henry Fonda, Jim Backus, Jean Stapleton, Jeff Corey, Royal Dano, Mariette Hartley, Janet McLachlan and Paul Newman appear and discuss problem areas that a film actor must deal with.

results.title: Five run away together. Five have a wonderful time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
In “Five run away together”, the children run away from Kirrin Cottage, when the bad Mrs. Stick, who is looking after them for a week, threatens to lock Timmy in the shed. They escape to Kirrin Island, where all is not as it should be. “Five have a wonderful time” introduces us to a snake-charmer called Miss Slither, and a fire-eater called Alfredo. While on their caravanning holiday, the children find that they must enlist the help of these new friends when they uncover a mystery at nearby Faynight’s Castle.

results.title: Five Go to Smuggler's Top
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
The Five go to Smuggler’s Top to stay with the Lenoir family. It is not long before they meet the eccentric Mr Barlowe - a man who seems to be responsible for the queer and highly suspicious things that are happening in the area. The five face a mystery full of excitement in and out of the underground secret passages and on the surrounding sea marshes. Rated: G

results.title: Five are together again. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
With Quentin Kirrin and his wife in quarantine for scarlet fever, the children are sent to stay with Professor Hayling and his son, Tinker. An exciting adventure begins when a circus comes to town and some ‘top secret’ notes disappear from the Professor’s study.

results.title: Five go down to the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
While on a cycling holiday in Cornwall, the Five hear how in the past, pirates used to set up a light on stormy nights on the Tremannon coast to wreck ships. The children investigate the cove at night and find that there are still mysterious lights and some sinister goings-on.
